title.narrative: Cooperation in the dairy sector-production, food safety and nutrition between Denmark and Indonesia SSC, Inception

description.narrative: Identification and formulation of phase I of the Strategic Sector Cooperation project on Agriculture and Food Safety.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Agriculture and Food Safety is a peer-to-peer cooperation in Indonesia. During the inception phase, the cooperation will determine the project’s specific focus and the main partner authority resulting in a partnership agreement, a project document containing project outcomes, outputs and activities. Potential areas of cooperation are: food safety and hygiene in the value chain and feed quality for the cattle
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

title.narrative: Improved framework conditions for sustainable development

SSC contributions in 2019 to framework conditions within dairy sector-production, food safety and nutrition in Indonesia: "No ".
Score: Yes or No. Yes meaning a project document has been signed
The project will officially be agreed upon with the Indonesian Ministry of Agriculture during spring 2020.
